text: C-flat major (or the key of C-flat) is a major scale based on C, containing the pitches C, D, E, F, G, A, and B. Its key signature has seven flats. B major, a key signature with five sharps, is the enharmonic equivalent of C-flat major. C-flat major is usually not used because it uses several flats. B major is normally used instead, because it only uses five sharps. The C-flat major scale is: == References == Category:Musical keys Category:Major scales
title: C-flat major
